terms.title: Terms & Conditions
terms.introDesc:
Welcome to the website of the UAE Media Council. Please read the terms and conditions carefully before using the website as they are clarifying the permitted and restricted usages.
Your access to and use of the website of the UAE Media Council is subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this document, in addition to the laws of the United Arab Emirates. Your access to the website means your acceptance of these terms and conditions, unconditionally, and these terms and conditions are:
terms.intellectualRightsDesc1: All copyrights, trademarks, copyright and other intellectual property rights in all materials on the Website (including without limitation images, audios, charts, reports, files, software, data, applications, information, text , videos, logos, models, artwork, other materials, animations, etc.) contained in or accessible through the Website are owned by the UAE Media Council.
terms.intellectualRightsDesc2: The information published on the website of the Council is for personal usage only, to conduct research and studies and to search for information and / or educational purposes only for the purposes of  requesting services.
terms.intellectualRightsDesc3: The use of information published on the website of the Council for any commercial purposes shall not be permitted, including but not limited to: sale of published materials, distribution or republication.
terms.gurantees: Second: Limits of Guarantees and Responsibilities
terms.guranteesDesc1: The Council may modify or delete the information published without prior notice.
terms.guranteesDesc2: The Council disclaims any liability for warranties and conditions relating to the information published.
terms.guranteesDesc3: The Council is not responsible for any damage or whatever the damage, caused by information published, directly or indirectly, or due to the use of the site.
terms.guranteesDesc4: The Council does not assume any liability for loss of data or damage to computer systems as a result of the use of the website or published material and also disclaims any liability for any guarantee that the website and/or the service provider is free of malware.
terms.guranteesDesc5: Users of the Council's website shall be liable for any damages arising from their use of the website, and they have to compensate the Council in the event of any damage or claim arising from their use of the website or the information published.
terms.guranteesDesc6: This document is a consent by the users of the website and of the Council to use of the website and it cancels any prior agreements in this regard.
terms.registrationDesc1: Some parts of the website are only available to the registered members, such as the use of electronic services and others.
terms.registrationDesc2: The use of an inappropriate user name is prohibited.
terms.registrationDesc3: When a user signs up the Council's website, he/she agrees to provide true, accurate, current and complete information.
terms.registrationDesc4: Every user is responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of his/her user name and password when completing the registration process, and takes responsibility for all activities carried out under his/her user name.
terms.registrationDesc5: Any attempt by any unauthorized person to access to another user’s data is prohibited.
terms.registrationDesc6: Attempting to use the name of another user to try to access the website is prohibited.
terms.registrationDesc7: If the password becomes known to any other unauthorized user, the Council shall be immediately informed so that it can close the account.
terms.registrationDesc8: The UAE Media Council is entitled to end access or use of the website without notice in case of violation of these terms and conditions and the Council will apply every and all-available means to block access.
terms.linksDesc1: The Council may publish links in its website that are related to other websites and the Council is not responsible for the content of such websites or the correctness of the contents published there about any services or information.
terms.linksDesc2: When choosing to use an external website link published on the UAEMC website, you will be subject to the terms and conditions of the owner of such external website.
terms.linksDesc3: Any material published on related the websites to the UAEMC website shall not deemed as an acceptance and acknowledgment of the Council for the contents of such associated materials or services.
terms.electronicCopiesDesc: The electronic copies of the documents of the Council published on its website are available for personal use, for research and studies, and to search for information and / or for educational purposes only. The final version of any document of the Council is the original version printed by the Council. If it is signed by the authorized person, the original version printed and signed by the Council shall dominate. In the event of any discrepancy between the two versions, the version kept with the Council shall dominate.
terms.versioningDesc: Information is published in the Council's website in Arabic and English. If there are any differences between the two versions in English and Arabic, then the original version shall dominate.
terms.lawsDesc: This document is protected by and construed in accordance with the laws of the United Arab Emirates. The UAE courts shall have the jurisdiction to consider any disputes arising from this document.
terms.adjustmentsDesc: The Council may modify the terms of this document without prior notice.
terms.responsibilitiesDesc1: The UAE Media Council does not assume any responsibility in any way for incidental or indirect, special, punitive, exemplary or emerging damages, which may arise as a result of your use of or inability to use the website, including, without limitation, loss of revenue or anticipated profits, loss of goodwill, loss of business, loss of data, or the computer breakdown or malfunction, or any other damages.
terms.responsibilitiesDesc2: In case of violation of these terms and conditions, UAEMC shall take and follow all legal procedures that hold the violator liable to civil and criminal liability, and will start investigation of the cases that may involve such violations and prosecute the violator.

accessibility.introDesc:
As part of our efforts to reach people with limited mobility and accessibility to the UAEMC services, we have designed the UAEMC e-service portal website with enhanced features that will ease the experience of dealing with the UAE Media Council.
Following are some of the features on our website that aim to benefit people with different abilities:
accessibility.zoomScreenDesc: For those with poor visual ability to read text and view images, can use the Zoom option from your browser to enlarge the page.
accessibility.textSizeDesc: If you have difficulty reading the text on our portal, you can increase or decrease the text-size by clicking on the 'A+' or 'A-' icons on the top right corner of the webpage.
accessibility.colorDesc: If you have difficulty reading the text due to the back ground color combinations, such as white text on a black background, you can change background colors in your browser easily.

To access the UAE Media Council eServices you need to have a verified UAE PASS account. Please visit the nearest kiosk to upgrade your UAE PASS account.

For more information, please check FAQ – General or call UAE Media Council at 800 552255

newspaperMagazineLicense.heading: NEWSPAPER / MAGAZINE LICENSE
newspaperMagazineLicense.newspaperOptionDesc: The publication includes a press release containing news articles, analysis, articles, and sections dedicated literature. It can be restricted to the purpose of publishing and distributing ideas in the form of information and advertisements, usually printing a copy on cheap paper. The newspaper can be a general or specialized newspaper, and may issue a journal such as being daily or weekly.
newspaperMagazineLicense.magazineOptionDesc: A publication is published periodically and contains many different articles. Magazines offer a variety of information, views and entertainment, covering current and fashion events, discussing foreign affairs, or explaining how to repair equipment and prepare food. Topics include magazines, business, culture, current events, hobbies, medicine, politics, religion, science, sports as well as fiction, poetry and photography. Magazines differ from newspapers in terms of form and content. Magazines are designed to keep them longer than newspapers. They are therefore smaller and better in shape
newspaperMagazineLicense.name: Name
newspaperMagazineLicense.yearsOfExperienceLimit: Your years of experience cannot be more than 50
newspaperMagazineLicense.requireEmarati: Electronic newspapers and magazines are allowed for Emarati only. Newspapers and magazines with NEW release type are allowed for Emarati only.
newspaperMagazineLicense.requiredCategories: You have to select newspaper/ magazine subjects from the list
newspaperMagazineLicense.requiredLanguages: You have to mention newspaper/ magazine name with desired language
